intro: Ainsliaea ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf ainsliaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Ainsliaea ovata is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments, making it a common species in forest understories.
